title: Roger Daltrey - 'Ride a Rock Horse' [320k MP3]
description:
Ride a Rock Horse is the second solo album by The Who's lead singer, Roger Daltrey. It was first released in 1975. Songs were recorded during Daltrey's filming commitments for Ken Russell's film Lisztomania.

Track listing [320k MP3]

"Come And Get Your Love" (Russ Ballard) - 3:46 
"Hearts Right" (Paul Korda) - 3:02 
"Oceans Away" (Phillip Goodhand-Tait) - 3:17 
"Proud" (Ballard) - 4:54 
"World Over" (Paul Korda) - 3:11 
"Near To Surrender" (Ballard) - 2:35 
"Feeling" (Paul Korda) - 4:38 
"Walking The Dog" (Rufus Thomas) - 4:37 
"Milk Train" (Bugatti/Musker) - 3:21 
"I Was Born To Sing Your Song" (Neal/Marchand) - 4:36 

BONUS TRACKS

"You Put Something Better Inside Me" (Gerry Rafferty, Joe Egan) (B-side of the 1977 single "One Of The Boys"; this version is an alternate outtake) 
"Dear John" (David Courtney) (B-side of the 1977 single "Written On The Wind"; the liner notes to the reissue CD state that this was an outtake from the Ride a Rock Horse sessions) 
"Oceans Away (alternate version)" (Goodhand-Tait)
